g.title: LC1_C1
g.text: Emergence and amplification of deception abilities in modern large language models and the resulting alignment risks.
State-of-the-art language models can represent other agentsâ€™ beliefs, including false beliefs.

g.title: LC1_C2
g.text: LLMs intentionally induce false beliefs in simple scenarios, demonstrating functional deception.

g.title: LC2_C2
g.text: Speculative interventions to detect, limit, or test deceptive behaviour in large language models.
LLMs intentionally induce false beliefs in simple scenarios.

g.title: LC1_C8
g.text: Deceptive behaviour in LLMs can bypass monitoring and harm users, posing a safety concern.

g.title: LC1_C3
g.text: Prompts that elicit long, step-by-step reasoning traces inside the model.

g.title: LC1_C4
g.text: Multi-step reasoning significantly raises success on complex deception tasks.

g.title: LC1_C5
g.text: Manipulative prefixes that heighten the modelâ€™s propensity to choose deceptive actions.

g.title: LC1_C6
g.text: Models occasionally deceive even without explicit deceptive triggers, indicating slight mis-alignment.

g.title: LC1_C7
g.text: Larger / newer models outperform smaller ones on both false-belief and deception tasks.

g.title: LC2_I4
g.text: During fine-tuning, negatively reinforce deceptive choices to reduce their likelihood.

g.title: LC2_I6
g.text: Create manipulative prompt sets to probe deception before release.

g.title: LC2_C4
g.text: Multi-step reasoning significantly raises success on complex deception tasks.

g.title: LC2_I2
g.text: Filter or withhold step-by-step reasoning from user outputs to limit deception amplification.

g.title: LC2_C5
g.text: Manipulative prefixes heighten the modelâ€™s propensity to choose deceptive actions.

g.title: LC2_I3
g.text: Detect and block manipulative prefixes that nudge the model toward deception.

g.title: LC2_C6
g.text: Models occasionally deceive even without explicit deceptive triggers.

g.title: LC2_I5
g.text: Continuously log and audit outputs for spontaneous deceptive behaviour.

g.title: LC2_C8
g.text: Deceptive behaviour in LLMs can bypass monitoring and harm users.

g.title: LC2_I1
g.text: Include standardized deception evaluations in pre-deployment testing.
